data.title: People and Jobs — Life Time Foundation
data.meta_description: Meet the people behind the Life Time Foundation.
data.text:
Director - Life Time Foundation and ESG Programs

Sarah wears many hats at Life Time, all with mission-driven focus. She leads Life Time’s broader ESG strategy and couldn’t be happier to be help inspire Happy People, a Healthy Planet and a Healthy Way Life with the Life Time Foundation.

Sarah is a busy body, and always on the go with her husband and three kids. As a true Minnesotan, she loves being outside in all four seasons, new adventures, and some good live music.

Senior Program Manager

Following her mission-driven personality and passion for healthy living, Val joined the Foundation in 2014. Today, she leads our collaborative work with schools and organizations to provide all kids with nourishing, minimally-processed foods and access to safe, enriching physical activity.

As program manager, Val collaborates with school food professionals and other non-profit partners, learning about their successes and challenges with the goal of making a healthy way of life more accessible for kids across the country, specifically those in historically underserved communities.

Val is originally from Buenos Aires, Argentina, and has enjoyed living in the U.S. for almost 22 years. In her spare time, she loves to read, travel, spend time with friends and play in the mountains.

Nutrition Program Manager

A registered dietitian with a passion for public health, Megan collaborates with school districts and purchasing cooperatives across the country - supporting them as they seek to serve the healthiest, most delicious food possible in their school food programs.

She is a proud Ingredient Guide for Better School Food Purchasing contributor and co-facilitator. Megan loves being a mother to a young daughter and son who both love their beets! She enjoys biking, beach volleyball and traveling with her husband.

Athlete Engagement & Development Associate

From managing the Foundation Athlete Program and donor communications to providing support to marketing and program teams, Lindsay wears many hats. She comes to the Foundation with great experience in communications and athletic events, as well as a master’s degree from the Friedman School of Nutrition Science & Policy and a law degree from the University of Oregon.

A former runner turned avid cyclist, Lindsay is passionate about nutrition and endurance sports. She’s the founder of PhxWmn and she hosts gravel cycling camps throughout the Mountain West.

Marketing Specialist

Lauren comes to the Foundation with a background in design, marketing, and branding, making her a great addition to the team as the Foundation Marketing Specialist. In this role, she does a little bit of everything, from marketing strategy to content creation, with social media being her favorite marketing channel.

Prior to moving to Minnesota and joining the Foundation, she lived in California and Tennessee. She holds a Bachelor of Science in Graphic Communication and Graphics in Packaging from California Polytechnic State University, San Luis Obispo, and a Master’s in Marketing from Vanderbilt University.

Youth Movement Ambassador

Dr. Jayne Greenberg has served as the Program Director for the I Can Do It! Program for the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. Prior to that she served as the District Director of Physical Education and Health Literacy for Miami-Dade County Public Schools.

Dr. Greenberg has served as a national and international consultant, has authored several books, has served as a co-editor of Physical Best, 5th edition, and is a Google Scholar. She has published numerous articles, and has been a speaker at several state, national, and International conventions and meetings. As a school district administrator in M-DCPS, Dr. Greenberg has further secured over $35 million in federal and foundation grants for educational programs.
